issues.title: Implement user authentication with SSO
issues.body:
## Description

As a user, I want to authenticate using Single Sign-On (SSO) so that I can access the application securely using my corporate credentials.

## Business Value

- Reduces password fatigue for users
- Improves security through centralized authentication
- Simplifies user onboarding and offboarding
- Enables enterprise-grade access control

## Preconditions

- SSO provider (Azure AD, Okta, or similar) must be configured
- OAuth 2.0 client credentials must be obtained
- Callback URLs must be registered with the provider

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] User can click "Sign in with SSO" button on login page
- [ ] User is redirected to SSO provider login page
- [ ] After successful authentication, user is redirected back with valid session
- [ ] User profile information is populated from SSO claims
- [ ] Session expires after 8 hours of inactivity
- [ ] Failed authentication shows appropriate error message

## User Guide

### For End Users

1. Navigate to the login page
2. Click the "Sign in with SSO" button
3. Enter your corporate email on the SSO provider page
4. Complete two-factor authentication if required
5. You will be automatically redirected to the dashboard

### For Administrators

Configuration steps:
```yaml
sso:
  provider: azure-ad
  client_id: ${SSO_CLIENT_ID}
  client_secret: ${SSO_CLIENT_SECRET}
  tenant_id: ${TENANT_ID}
```

## Connections

- Related to #102 (Multi-factor authentication)
- Depends on #103 (User profile management)
- See also: [Security Architecture](https://docs.example.com/security)

## Last Edited

Last updated by alice@example.com on 2026-01-20

issues.title: Add multi-factor authentication support
issues.body:
## Overview

Enhance security by implementing multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all user accounts.

## Why

MFA significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access even if passwords are compromised. Industry best practice and compliance requirement for enterprise applications.

## Setup

| Component | Requirement | Status |
|-----------|-------------|--------|
| TOTP Library | pyotp >= 2.8.0 | ✅ Available |
| QR Code Generator | qrcode >= 7.4.0 | ✅ Available |
| SMS Gateway | Twilio API | ⚠️ Pending setup |

## AC

1. **TOTP Setup**
   - User can enable MFA from account settings
   - QR code is displayed for authenticator app setup
   - Backup codes are generated (10 codes)
   
2. **Login Flow**
   - After password validation, MFA code prompt appears
   - User enters 6-digit code from authenticator app
   - Code must be valid within 30-second window
   - 3 failed attempts lock account for 15 minutes

3. **Recovery Options**
   - User can use backup codes when authenticator unavailable
   - Admin can reset MFA for user accounts
   - SMS fallback option for verified phone numbers

## Instructions

Enabling MFA:
1. Go to Profile → Security Settings
2. Click "Enable Two-Factor Authentication"
3. Scan QR code with Google Authenticator, Authy, or similar app
4. Enter verification code to confirm
5. Save backup codes in secure location

## Related

- #101 - SSO authentication (works together with MFA)
- #104 - Session management
- External: [OWASP MFA Guidelines](https://owasp.org/mfa)

## Changes

Modified by bob@example.com on 2026-01-21 - Added SMS fallback requirement

issues.title: User profile management dashboard
issues.body:
## Summary

Create a user profile management dashboard where users can view and edit their account information.

## Value

Empowers users to manage their own information, reducing support burden and improving user satisfaction.

## Prerequisites

- User authentication must be implemented (#101)
- Database schema for user profiles must be ready
- Frontend framework (React) must be set up

## Done Criteria

- User can view current profile information (name, email, avatar)
- User can edit profile fields with inline validation
- Changes are saved immediately with visual feedback
- Profile picture upload supports JPEG, PNG (max 5MB)
- Audit log tracks all profile changes

## How To

**Accessing Your Profile:**
- Click your avatar in top-right corner
- Select "Profile Settings" from dropdown menu

**Editing Information:**
- Click the edit icon next to any field
- Make your changes
- Changes save automatically when you click outside the field

**Profile Picture:**
- Click "Change Photo" button
- Select image file (JPEG or PNG, under 5MB)
- Crop if desired, then confirm

## Links

Related issues: #101, #105
Design mockups: [Figma Link](https://figma.com/file/xyz)

issues.title: Implement session management and timeout
issues.body:
## Description

Implement secure session management with configurable timeout and automatic cleanup.

Key requirements:
- Session tokens stored securely (httpOnly, secure, sameSite cookies)
- Configurable session timeout (default: 8 hours)
- Automatic session extension on user activity
- Session cleanup job runs every hour
- Multiple concurrent sessions per user (max 5)

## Business Value

Balances security and user convenience. Automatic timeout prevents unauthorized access from unattended sessions while activity tracking minimizes disruption to active users.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Session tokens use UUID v4 format
- [ ] Tokens are stored with expiration timestamp in Redis
- [ ] Cookie flags: httpOnly=true, secure=true, sameSite=strict
- [ ] Activity within 30 minutes extends session by configured timeout
- [ ] Expired sessions return 401 Unauthorized
- [ ] User can view and revoke active sessions from settings
- [ ] Session data includes: IP address, user agent, last activity timestamp

## Connections

Blocks: #102 (MFA needs session management)
Related: #101 (SSO creates sessions)

issues.title: Add notification preferences
issues.body:
## Overview

Allow users to configure their notification preferences for email, in-app, and mobile push notifications.

## Value

Users can control communication frequency and channels, reducing notification fatigue and improving engagement.

## Done Criteria

- Settings page with notification preferences UI
- Toggle switches for each notification type:
  - Email notifications (on/off)
  - In-app notifications (on/off)  
  - Push notifications (on/off)
- Granular controls:
  - Security alerts (always on)
  - Account updates (optional)
  - Marketing emails (optional)
  - Weekly digest (optional)
- Preferences saved per user in database
- Notification service respects user preferences before sending

## User Guide

1. Navigate to Settings → Notifications
2. Toggle switches for desired notification types
3. Expand "Advanced Options" for granular controls
4. Click "Save Preferences" (auto-saves enabled by default)

issues.title: Fix pagination offset calculation bug
issues.body:
## Description

Pagination offset calculation is incorrect when page size is not 10. This causes wrong results to be displayed on pages 2+.

**Bug Details:**
```python
# Current (wrong):
offset = page * page_size

# Should be:
offset = (page - 1) * page_size
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Fix offset calculation in all paginated endpoints
- [ ] Add unit tests for pagination edge cases
- [ ] Test with page sizes: 5, 10, 20, 50, 100
- [ ] Verify page 1 shows items 1-N
- [ ] Verify page 2 shows items N+1 to 2N

## Last Edited

Fixed and deployed by charlie@example.com on 2026-01-26

issues.title: API documentation with OpenAPI/Swagger
issues.body:
## Summary

Generate comprehensive API documentation using OpenAPI 3.0 specification and Swagger UI.

## Why

API documentation improves developer experience and reduces integration time for external teams.

## Preconditions

- API endpoints must be stable and versioned (v1)
- FastAPI/Flask framework must support OpenAPI decorators
- Hosting environment for Swagger UI docs

## Acceptance Criteria

OpenAPI Specification:
- [ ] All endpoints documented with descriptions
- [ ] Request/response schemas defined
- [ ] Authentication requirements specified
- [ ] Example requests and responses included
- [ ] Error responses documented (4xx, 5xx)

Swagger UI:
- [ ] Accessible at /api/docs endpoint
- [ ] Interactive "Try it out" functionality works
- [ ] Supports authentication token input
- [ ] Auto-generated from code annotations

## Instructions

Accessing API Docs:
- Navigate to https://api.example.com/docs
- Click "Authorize" button to enter API token
- Expand any endpoint to see details
- Click "Try it out" to test directly from browser

## Related

- #108 - API versioning strategy
- #109 - Rate limiting
- External docs: [OpenAPI Specification](https://swagger.io/specification/)

issues.title: Implement API versioning strategy
issues.body:
## Description

Establish API versioning strategy to support backward compatibility and smooth migrations.

**Proposed Approach:**
- URL path versioning: `/api/v1/`, `/api/v2/`
- Major version in path, minor/patch in header
- Deprecation notices 3 months before removal
- Support N-1 versions (current + previous)

## Business Value

Enables API evolution without breaking existing integrations. Reduces coordination overhead for external teams consuming our API.

## Setup

- Update API gateway routing rules
- Implement version detection middleware
- Create deprecation warning mechanism
- Update CI/CD to deploy multiple versions

## AC

1. **Version Detection**
   - Requests to `/api/v1/users` route to v1 handler
   - Requests to `/api/v2/users` route to v2 handler
   - Missing version defaults to latest stable
   
2. **Deprecation Handling**
   - Deprecated endpoints return `Deprecation` header
   - Header includes sunset date and migration guide URL
   - Deprecated endpoints logged for usage analytics

3. **Documentation**
   - Version-specific documentation at /docs/v1, /docs/v2
   - Migration guide between versions
   - Changelog with breaking changes highlighted

## Connections

Related to #107 (API documentation)

issues.title: Add API rate limiting
issues.body:
## Description

Implement rate limiting to prevent API abuse and ensure fair resource allocation.

**Rate Limits:**
- Anonymous: 100 requests/hour
- Authenticated: 1000 requests/hour
- Premium tier: 5000 requests/hour

## Value

Protects API availability and performance. Prevents denial-of-service attacks and ensures quality of service for all users.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Rate limiting based on IP address for anonymous users
- [ ] Rate limiting based on API token for authenticated users
- [ ] Redis backend for distributed rate limit tracking
- [ ] Response headers include rate limit info:
  - `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Total requests allowed
  - `X-RateLimit-Remaining`: Requests remaining
  - `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Unix timestamp when limit resets
- [ ] 429 Too Many Requests response when limit exceeded
- [ ] Retry-After header indicates wait time in seconds

## History

Implemented by dave@example.com on 2026-01-27

issues.title: Database migration to PostgreSQL 15
issues.body:
## Overview

Migrate production database from PostgreSQL 12 to PostgreSQL 15 to leverage performance improvements and new features.

## Business Value

- 30% faster query performance (benchmark results)
- Improved JSON query capabilities
- Better index management
- Extended support lifecycle

## Prerequisites

- Complete backup of production database
- Test migration on staging environment
- Verify application compatibility with PG 15
- Plan maintenance window (estimated 4 hours)
- Rollback procedure documented and tested

## Acceptance Criteria

Pre-Migration:
- [ ] Full database backup completed and verified
- [ ] Staging migration successful with zero data loss
- [ ] All application tests pass against PG 15
- [ ] Migration runbook reviewed by team
- [ ] Stakeholders notified of maintenance window

Migration:
- [ ] Enable read-only mode on current database
- [ ] Dump database using pg_dump
- [ ] Provision PostgreSQL 15 instance
- [ ] Restore data to new instance
- [ ] Run ANALYZE to update statistics
- [ ] Update application connection strings
- [ ] Verify data integrity checksums

Post-Migration:
- [ ] All application endpoints responding correctly
- [ ] Monitor query performance for 24 hours
- [ ] Keep PG 12 instance running for 1 week (rollback option)
- [ ] Update documentation with new connection details

## User Guide

**During Maintenance:**
- Application will be read-only from 02:00-06:00 UTC on 2026-02-01
- No action required from end users
- Service will automatically reconnect after migration

**For Developers:**
- Update local connection strings to new instance
- Connection pooling parameters may need adjustment
- Review [PostgreSQL 15 release notes](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/release-15.html)

## Connections

- Blocks #111 (performance optimization depends on PG 15 features)
- Related: Infrastructure upgrade initiative

## Changes

Migration date updated by sre@example.com on 2026-01-26

issues.title: Implement audit logging system
issues.body:
## Overview

Implement comprehensive audit logging for compliance and security monitoring.

## Why

Regulatory compliance requires detailed audit trails. Security teams need visibility into user actions for threat detection and incident investigation.

## Preconditions

- Log aggregation infrastructure (ELK or similar) must be ready
- Data retention policy must be approved (7 years for financial data)
- Log storage capacity planned and provisioned

## AC

**Events to Log:**
- User authentication (login, logout, failed attempts)
- Authorization changes (role assignments, permission changes)
- Data access (view, export of sensitive data)
- Data modifications (create, update, delete)
- Administrative actions (user management, configuration changes)
- Security events (password resets, MFA changes)

**Log Format:**
```json
{
  "timestamp": "2026-01-28T09:00:00Z",
  "event_type": "data_access",
  "actor": "user@example.com",
  "action": "export_report",
  "resource": "financial_report_2025",
  "ip_address": "192.168.1.100",
  "user_agent": "Mozilla/5.0...",
  "result": "success",
  "metadata": {}
}
```

**Requirements:**
- [ ] Logs written to append-only storage
- [ ] Tamper-proof audit trail (checksums)
- [ ] Centralized log collection
- [ ] 7-year retention for compliance logs
- [ ] 90-day retention for operational logs
- [ ] Search and reporting UI for security team
- [ ] Automated alerts for suspicious patterns

## User Guide

**For Security Team:**
- Access audit logs at /admin/audit
- Search by user, event type, or date range
- Export results to CSV for compliance reports

**For Administrators:**
- Configure retention policies in admin panel
- Set up email alerts for critical events
- Review daily summary reports

## Connections

- Related to #101, #102 (authentication/authorization events)
- Related to compliance initiative
- External: [OWASP Logging Guide](https://owasp.org/logging)

issues.title: Mobile app: offline mode support
issues.body:
## Summary

Enable offline mode in mobile app to allow users to work without internet connectivity.

## Business Value

Users can continue working during travel or in areas with poor connectivity. Improves user satisfaction and productivity.

## Prerequisites

- Mobile app architecture supports local storage
- Conflict resolution strategy defined
- Background sync mechanism implemented

## Done Criteria

Offline Capabilities:
- [ ] View cached content (last 7 days)
- [ ] Create new items (queued for sync)
- [ ] Edit existing items (queued for sync)
- [ ] Delete items (queued for sync)
- [ ] Search within cached content

Sync Behavior:
- [ ] Automatic sync when connectivity restored
- [ ] Manual sync trigger in app
- [ ] Conflict detection and resolution UI
- [ ] Progress indicator during sync
- [ ] Failed sync items highlighted for user review

Storage:
- [ ] Max 100MB local storage per user
- [ ] Automatic cache cleanup (30 days)
- [ ] User can manually clear cache

## How To

**Using Offline Mode:**
1. Ensure app is synced while online
2. App automatically detects loss of connectivity
3. Offline indicator appears in header
4. Continue working - changes saved locally
5. When back online, app syncs automatically
6. Review "Sync Status" to see pending changes

**Handling Conflicts:**
- If conflict detected, app shows both versions
- User chooses which version to keep
- Option to merge changes manually

## Links

Design: [Offline UX Mockups](https://figma.com/file/offline)
Related: #114 (sync optimization)
